byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Stephen Castle from London. Aleksandar Dimishkovski contributed reporting from Skopje, Macedonia, and Lilia Blaise from Paris.
byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and STEPHEN CASTLE

abstract: Macedonia becomes latest country to be overwhelmed by migrant crisis sweeping Europe as waves of displaced people flee violence in Syria, Iraq and elsewhere in the Middle East and Africa; declares state of emergency as it deploys troops to border areas.
lead_paragraph: The three European nations announced added measures to address the biggest movement of people seen in Europe since the aftermath of World War II.

headline.main: Migrant Influx Prompts Macedonia, Britain and France to Increase Security
headline.print_headline: Migrant Influx Prompts 3 European Countries to Increase Security

snippet: The three European nations announced added measures to address the biggest movement of people seen in Europe since the aftermath of World War II.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
